titleInfo.title: F.A. Reeve in Washington, D.C., to O.P. Temple in Knoxville, Tennessee

subject.geographic: The Development of the Industrial United States (1870-1900).

subject.topic: federal patronage; federal court; Union; carpet-baggers.

mods.note: This letter questions Judge Andrews` resignation and the immediate recommendation of Wheeler by Thornburg when Andrews knew that Reeve wanted the position. Reeve states that it is time that the carpet bag dynasty in East Tennessee be overthrown.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
